creator: unicoletti@prometeo.it
text:
When compiling mod_jk on FreeBSD (uname -a >
FreeBSD ****.it 4.7-RELEASE FreeBSD 4.7-RELEASE #0: Wed Oct  9 15:08:34 GMT 2002
    root@builder.freebsdmall.com:/usr/obj/usr/src/sys/GENERIC  i386) you get an
annoying syntax error. A patch is reported down below.

gcc --version
2.95.4

diff -r
jakarta-tomcat-connectors-4.1.27-src-working/jk/native/common/jk_uri_worker_map.c
jakarta-tomcat-connectors-4.1.27-src/jk/native/common/jk_uri_worker_map.c
492c492
<         char *clean_uri = jk_pool_strdup(&uw_map->tp,uri);
---
>         char * clean_uri = jk_pool_strdup(&uw_map->tp,uri);;

After you take away the double semicolon everything works fine.
No such code in current cvs
creator: hgomez@apache.org
